title: Dog named Clifford spent five long days trapped on steep cliff face
text:
A dog spent five days trapped on a dangerous cliff face – before being carried to safety by two kindly rock climber volunteers, who have since christened the sweet-natured animal Clifford (Picture: KMVT)

A dog spent five long days trapped on a steep cliff face before finally being rescued.

The unlucky animal – since christened Clifford in honor of his ordeal – was spotted stuck on a rocky outcrop in Twin Falls, Idaho, earlier this month.

His plight caught the attention of locals, but a rescue attempt to save Clifford was deemed too dangerous – until some kind-hearted rock climbers stepped in.

One of those climbers, Dave Wright, told KMVT that he and his fellow volunteers used a drone to map a safe route before making the ascent.

Wright, who also works for Friends Furever Animal Rescue, said: ‘Once we reached him, we sat up there with him for a little bit to get him used to us and help him feel more confident.’

Clifford was then given some water and an energy bar to sustain him for the descent back down to safety.

After he was deemed sufficiently relaxed, Wright and friend Richard Jensen carefully began clearing a path.

They then passed Clifford to one another, with the sweet-natured dog finally returned to safety around 90 minutes later.

Clifford was taken to a vet, where he was found to have suffered only minor wounds.

This photo gives a better idea of the size of the drop Clifford would have faced had he fallen from his perch on the edge of the cliff (Picture: KMVT)

It is unclear how he ended up on the cliff face, and no-one has claimed him.

Clifford is currently residing in a foster home, and will be put up for adoption in the coming weeks.
description: The dog was trapped a quarter of a way down an extremely high cliff face. It took a team of kindly volunteer rescuers to bring him back to safety
